description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for a part time **Member Experience Advisor** to join our **Lac La Biche Branch!**


**Posting closes: January 22, 2026**


**Employment Status: Part time (guaranteed 20 hours a week with full flexibility up to 37\.5 hours per week)**



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



The Member Experience Advisor role acts as the first line of support as members work towards their financial goals. This role is responsible for providing exceptional member service by completing transactional banking services that are right for every member, providing solutions to financial needs or referring members to an appropriate specialist, and contributing to the branch portfolio, and overall growth objectives.


**What You'll be Doing:**


* Provides exceptional member service that builds trust through responsive service and support to deliver what is right for every member, while balancing the interests of the credit union.
* Processes a variety of cash and non\-cash member service transactions including deposits, withdrawals, payments, account updates, balances, money orders, credit card advances, calculations of foreign and domestic exchanges, cheque cashing, electronic funds transfers, and account closures.
* Pursues and generates sales referrals by proactively promoting Servus products and services to members and potential members by analyzing their needs; clearly explains potential solutions and the benefits to the member; records all referrals and forwards to the appropriate internal personnel.
* Builds trust with members, resolves routine problems with member accounts and refers complex questions to the appropriate internal personnel.
* Applies policies and procedures in daily activities to meet safety, legal and privacy requirements.
* Accountable for area security and internal security audits.
* Educates and demonstrates to members how to use other service delivery channels such as digital and self\-serve with the goal of making it easy.
* Provides support to other branch team members such as making outgoing calls to members, composing routine member correspondence and reports, completing compliance and/or audit activities, completing end\-to\-end processes related to ATM and night deposits, reconciling branch reports (dependent on branch location), etc.
* Assists with opening/closing duties such as balancing of branch daily transmittals, reconciling ATM and night deposit contents, and provides support in administering branch cash services with the associated risk management and control policies.
* Acts as joint custodian on specified combinations; rents, controls, and provides access to safety deposit boxes; maintains related records.
* Maintains up\-to\-date knowledge of all credit union products and services in order to foster business development through service excellence and product knowledge.
* Promotes and participates in branch campaigns and initiatives.


**What you Bring:**


* 1\-year experience in a customer service or administration role.
* Sales experience an asset.
* Grade 12 diploma or equivalent.
* An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be considered.
* Good computer skills; able to pick up new and existing programs related to the job quickly.
* Good communication skills; both written and verbal.
* Ability to problem solve, organize and multi\-task.
* Good customer service orientation.
* Attention to detail.
* Aptitude for numbers, with fast and accurate data entry skills.
* Good financial literacy.
* Good investigative skills for uncovering member needs.


**Why Servus?**


Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!*


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**


*We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and* *only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.*



\#indh
title: Member Experience Advisor - Lac La Biche

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for a Full\-time **Assistant Branch Manager** to join our **Fairview Branch**!


**Posting closes:** January 16, 2026


**Employment Status:** Full\-time, 37\.5 hours per week


**Additional Information:** If selected for interview, please come prepared with a 30\-60\-90 day plan for the branch.


**For Internal Use Only \- Job Grade:** M1/B



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**

As an Assistant Branch Manager, reporting to the Market Director, your primary goal is to empower, support and develop your team of Financial Advisors. As an Assistant Branch Manager, you have a passion for leading people and can help your Financial Advisors understand our member's needs, therefore driving performance and success for the branch. You are an expert in the sales process and delivering progressive lending and investment services to our members.


**What You'll be Doing:**


* Motivating and coaching employees to find opportunities to shape members financial fitness
* Being proactive in pursuing new business opportunities
* Monitoring and ensuring financial targets are being met or exceeded for the branch
* Promoting referrals to our Wealth Management, Business Banking and 3rd party providers
* Adhering to policies, procedures, and loss prevention guidelines to mitigate risk of loss
* Providing support, guidance, and training to all employees as necessary to ensure performance improvement and cohesive teamwork
* Preparing accurate and complete documentation, processing account changes, and handling member inquiries in a timely and efficient manner


**What you Bring:**


* 5 years of retail banking experience
* A minimum of 3 years experience as a Financial Advisor
* A comprehensive understanding of lending and credit


Although not required, the following education/certificates are valuable assets:


* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)
* Investment Funds in Canada Course \& License (IFIC)
* Personal Financial Service Advice (PFSA)
* Financial Planning I (FP1\)


**Why Servus?**



Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential
* Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.



At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**



We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.
   

\#indh
title: Assistant Branch Manager - Fairview

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for a **Financial Advisor/ Senior Financial Advisor** in our **South Trail Branch.**


**Posting Closes:** Open Until Filled



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



Reporting to the Branch Manager, your primary objective is to bring our noble purpose to life by developing long term relationships with members, building trust, and delivering customized financial solutions that shape their financial fitness.


**What you’ll be doing:**

* Identifying opportunities to match members with the right products and solutions that help shape their financial fitness
* Meeting and exceeding sales targets and referral goals
* Participating and assisting in business development plans through corporate/branch marketing campaigns
* Demonstrating excellent communication skills and engaging members in conversations to determine their immediate needs
* Developing ongoing knowledge of our current investment/retail banking services and products (e.g., mutual funds, underwriting, credits, loans, investment needs, etc.)
* Promoting referrals to our Wealth Management, Business Banking teams, and our 3rd party providers
* Building a comprehensive knowledge of the local market, competitive offers, and economic trends
* Adhering to all audits, policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements to mitigate risks of fraud or loss
* Providing outstanding member experience by adhering to Servus' best practices
* Contributing to Servus' unparalleled culture of teamwork, positivity, and collaboration
* Maintaining Servus' positive image in the community


**What you bring:**



To qualify, you will need **at least 2 years of retail banking or related financial industry experience, preferably in sales or customer service and a high school diploma.**

Although not required, the following education/certificates are valuable assets:


* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)
* Investment Funds in Canada Course \& License (IFIC)
* Personal Financial Service Advice (PFSA)
* Financial Planning I (FP1\)


Most importantly, we're looking for candidates whose personal values align with our cooperative values. These values are evident in everything we do everyday. We're not afraid to be different from our competitors and in fact we embrace these differences. We celebrate our credit union culture and history, and we pride ourselves on our strong commitment to our member\-owners and to the communities we serve.


**Why Servus?**



Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential
* Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to* *apply!*


***Employment Eligibility for external candidates:*** *The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.*
title: Financial Advisor/ Senior Financial Advisor - South Trail Branch

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for a full time **Senior Data Technology \& Reporting Analyst** to join our **People \& Culture Operations** Team!


**Posting closes: January 19, 2026**


**Employment Status:** Full\-time, 37\.5 hours per week


**For Internal Use Only:** P3/B



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**

As a *Senior Data Technology and Reporting Analyst*, reporting to the *Manager, HRIS and People Data*, you'll collaborate closely with the Data Technology and Reporting Analyst, HRIS Specialist, Information Systems (IS) team, and other stakeholders, ensuring seamless alignment of data, process, and technology initiatives with organizational goals. By leveraging analytics, automation, and process frameworks, this position helps to drive the optimization of P\&C operations and workforce strategies.

  


**What You'll be Doing:**


***Data Management and Analytics***


* Lead the development and optimization of P\&C data models, dashboards, and metrics for workforce insights.
* Lead the analysis of P\&C data to identify trends in engagement, turnover, recruitment, and performance.
* Take ownership of and implement data governance best practices and ensure data quality and compliance.


***Business Process Management (BPM) Support***


* Map and optimize P\&C processes using BPM methodologies (e.g., Lean, Six Sigma).
* Identify bottlenecks and opportunities for automation in P\&C workflows.


***Technology Integration***


* Partner with the HRIS Specialist to address data\-related technology issues and ensure alignment between analytics and HR technology platforms.
* Oversee data integration across P\&C systems, ensuring smooth workflows and enhanced usability of analytics tools.
* Collaborate with external vendors to support system enhancements and issue resolution.


***Data Governance and Compliance***


* Strengthen data governance practices by leading the development of, aligning with, and implementing policies that ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and organizational standards.
* Work with stakeholders to resolve data discrepancies and continuously improve data quality.


***Collaboration and Communication***


* Present data findings clearly to technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning in data management and process improvement.

  


**What you Bring:**


**Experience and Education:**


* Post\-secondary diploma or degree in Business, Data Analytics, Human Resources, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and integration, with demonstrated knowledge in Business Analysis, with a focus on building models and analyzing complex datasets.
* Proven expertise in maintaining HR technology platforms (e.g., UKG, Workday, SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle HCM).
* Experience supporting process improvement initiatives using BPM frameworks and methodologies.
* Familiarity with data governance practices.
* Experience creating predictive models or leveraging machine learning to identify workforce trends is considered an asset.
* Advanced proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and SQL.
* Knowledge of APIs and tools for integrating data across platforms, system integration, and process mapping techniques (e.g., BPMN).
* Demonstrated ability to translate data and business needs into meaningful insights and actionable requirements.

  


**Licenses and Certifications:**


* Chartered Professional in Human Resources (CPHR) designation is considered an asset.
* Certifications in Business Analysis (e.g., IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional \- CBAP) or analytics tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) or BPM methodologies (e.g., Lean Six Sigma) are highly desirable.

  


**Additional Skills That Will Support Your Success:**


* Excellent communication skills to present data findings and process recommendations effectively to diverse audiences.
* Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross\-functional teams to align data, process, and technology practices with business objectives.
* High attention to detail and accuracy in managing datasets and process workflows.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
* Familiarity with HR and workforce metrics/terminology (ex. employee engagement, turnover, and performance).

  


**Why Servus?**



Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential
* Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.



At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!


***Employment Eligibility:*** *The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.*


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**



We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.

title: Senior Data Technology & Reporting Analyst

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** **\-** **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**


**Posting closes:** January 16, 2026, 4:00 pm


**Employment Status:** In\-person, Full\-Time (37\.5 hours per week), permanent.



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



We are hiring for a part\-time **Member Experience Advisor** at our **Shawnessy branch** in **Calgary!**



The Member Experience Advisor role acts as the first line of support as members work towards their financial goals. This role is responsible for providing exceptional member service by completing transactional banking services that are right for every member, providing solutions to financial needs or referring members to an appropriate specialist, and contributing to the branch portfolio, and overall growth objectives.


**What You'll be Doing:**


* Provides exceptional member service that builds trust through responsive service and support to deliver what is right for every member, while balancing the interests of the credit union.
* Processes a variety of cash and non\-cash member service transactions including deposits, withdrawals, payments, account updates, balances, money orders, credit card advances, calculations of foreign and domestic exchanges, cheque cashing, electronic funds transfers, and account closures.
* Pursues and generates sales referrals by proactively promoting Servus products and services to members and potential members by analyzing their needs; clearly explains potential solutions and the benefits to the member; records all referrals and forwards to the appropriate internal personnel.
* Builds trust with members, resolves routine problems with member accounts and refers complex questions to the appropriate internal personnel.
* Applies policies and procedures in daily activities to meet safety, legal and privacy requirements.
* Accountable for area security and internal security audits.
* Educates and demonstrates to members how to use other service delivery channels such as digital and self\-serve with the goal of making it easy.
* Provides support to other branch team members such as making outgoing calls to members, composing routine member correspondence and reports, completing compliance and/or audit activities, completing end\-to\-end processes related to ATM and night deposits, reconciling branch reports (dependent on branch location), etc.
* Assists with opening/closing duties such as balancing of branch daily transmittals, reconciling ATM and night deposit contents, and provides support in administering branch cash services with the associated risk management and control policies.
* Acts as joint custodian on specified combinations; rents, controls, and provides access to safety deposit boxes; maintains related records.
* Maintains up\-to\-date knowledge of all credit union products and services in order to foster business development through service excellence and product knowledge.
* Promotes and participates in branch campaigns and initiatives.


**What you Bring:**


* 1\-year experience in a customer service or administration role.
* Sales experience an asset.
* Grade 12 diploma or equivalent.
* An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be considered.
* Good computer skills; able to pick up new and existing programs related to the job quickly.
* Good communication skills; both written and verbal.
* Ability to problem solve, organize and multi\-task.
* Good customer service orientation.
* Attention to detail.
* Aptitude for numbers, with fast and accurate data entry skills.
* Good financial literacy.
* Good investigative skills for uncovering member needs.


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to* *apply!*


***Employment Eligibility for externals:*** *The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.*


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**


*We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and* *only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.*

title: Member Experience Advisor - Shawnessy

**Posting closes:** January 12, 2026


**Employment Status:** Part\-Time, permanent, Minimum of 20 hours scheduled per week



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. title: Member Experience Advisor - Crescent Heights

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for **Insurance Planning Specialist** to join our **Servus Wealth Strategies Team****!**


**Posting closes:** Until Filled


**Employment Status:** Full\-time


**Location:** In person role, candidates are required to work from one of our locations in Calgary, Edmonton, or Red Deer.


**Salary:** Base, plus bonus structure.


**For Internal Use Only:** S3/A

  



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



Reporting to the Regional Vice President, Insurance Services our Insurance Planning Specialists are the diligent professionals who help our members and employees find the right individual life, disability, and critical illness insurance solutions to suit their needs. They are trusted insurance planners that provide sound advice to ensure our members have the right insurance in place to protect their assets and income against unexpected events that may occur.


**What You'll be Doing:**


* Helping members uncover and understand the need for insurance, and work with the member to put those insurance solutions in place as part of their holistic financial plan.
* Be proactive in reaching out to existing policy holders for review, uncovering new needs and retention.
* Uncover the full financial needs of our members and referring those members to a Financial Advisor, Business Banking Advisor, Financial Planner, and Wealth Protection Specialists.
* Actively participate and support Retail and Wealth partners– always with a member\-centric focus – doing what’s right for the member.
* Maintain up to date Financial Planning and insurance industry knowledge by participating in training programs/industry courses to upgrade skills, obtain and maintain accreditation and licensing requirements.


**What you Bring:**


**Experience:**

* 2 or more years of experience in Insurance
* Ability to analyze and interpret the needs of clients and offer the appropriate insurance solutions
* Proven experience in providing detailed and accurate information to third parties
* Experience with life, disability and health insurance sales


**Education:**


* Life /Accident and Sickness Insurance License in the Province of Alberta
* Certified Financial Planner (CFP) or working towards designation
* Chartered Life Underwriter (CLU) designation and/or equivalent work experience is an asset


**Why Servus?**


Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!*

*We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and* *only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.*



\#indh
title: Insurance Planning Specialist

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**


***Posting Closes: January 19, 2026***


**For Internal Use Only: S1/B**



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



We are looking for a full\-time **Universal Financial Associate** in our **Provost branch.**



Reporting to the Assistant Branch Manager, our Universal Financial Associate plays an integral role in the branch by supporting our members with all their banking needs. As a Universal Financial Associate, you'll prepare documents for member meetings, provide regular proactive contact and follow\-up with members, handle discussions with walk\-in members, and a variety of administrative and branch support activities. You'll also help the branch and our members by processing daily banking transactions and recommending products and services to ensure our members feel good about their money.


**What you’ll be doing:**


* Proactively gather and document all pertinent information required for the Financial Advisor to have a robust conversation.
* Reviewing personal accounts for completeness, accuracy, and ensure they are fully compliant. Look for recommendations to shape the members financial fitness.
* Opening and reviewing new accounts, following up with members as per member service guidelines.
* Preparing and entering loan application information.
* Supporting branch activities to grow new memberships and strengthen our financial relationship with existing members.
* Clearly and skillfully differentiate between credit union and competitor products and services. Present advice and solutions that will serve to improve the member's financial situation
* With accuracy, processing member transactions such as deposits, withdrawals, loan and utility payments, money orders, credit card advances, calculation of foreign and domestic exchange \& cheque cashing


**What you bring:**


* At least 1 year **retail banking or sales experience in addition to your high school diploma.**


Although not required, the following education/certificates are valuable assets:


* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)
* IFIC certification


**Why Servus?**


Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential
* Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**



We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!*


***External Employment Eligibility:****The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.*


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**



We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.

title: Universal Financial Associate - Provost Branch

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**


**We are hiring for full\-time Financial Advisors to join our Member Contact Centre!**


**Employment Status:** Full\-time, this position is fully remote, however, applicants must reside within Alberta.



Additional Information: This full\-time position has the expectation to work flexible shifts, as our contact centre is open 24 hours, Monday\-Sunday, including rotational shifts of days, evenings, weekends, and holidays. The scheduled hours for this role will be between 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM.


**Posting closes:** Until Filled



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



Reporting to the Market Director, your primary objective is to develop long term relationships with members, building trust, and delivering customized financial solutions that help them feel good about their money.


**What you'll be doing:**


* Answering member inquires and provide exceptional member service via inbound calls, emails, chat, SMS, video calls.
* Demonstrating excellent sales techniques, strong negotiation skills, and the ability to close deals, along with a professional telephone manner and strong multi\-tasking abilities.
* Providing consistently fantastic member experience by adhering to standards and guidelines.
* Consistently being proactive in identifying and pursuing sales opportunities to match every member with the right products and solutions that enhance their financial fitness.
* Assisting members regarding technical inquiries or requests related to their online and mobile banking needs (e.g., setting passwords, updating member database, security\-related tasks, etc.).
* Participating in individual, Contact Centre, and corporate campaigns while adhering to call quality standards


**What you bring:**



To qualify, you will need at least **2 years of successful sales experience with measured targets,** preferably in customer service or retail banking, and a high school diploma.



Although not required, the following education/certificates are valuable assets:


* Call centre experience
* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)


Moreover, we are highly motivated in hiring candidates with flexible schedules, as the position requires day, evening, and weekend shift commitments.



Most importantly, we're looking for candidates whose personal values align with our cooperative values. These values are evident in everything we do everyday. We're not afraid to be different from our competitors and in fact we embrace these differences. We celebrate our credit union culture and history, and we pride ourselves on our strong commitment to our member\-owners and to the communities we serve.


**Why Servus?**

* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential

At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!

Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!*

**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**


**Posting Closes: Until Filled**


***Employment Eligibility: The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.***


*We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and* *only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.*

  



\#indh
title: Financial Advisor - Member Contact Centre

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union \- Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for a **Regional Vice President \- Agriculture in Central Alberta!**


**Posting is Open Until: January 9, 2026**


**Additional Information:** Travel is expected to Olds, Red Deer, Ponoka, Drumheller and Strathmore


**For Internal Use Only:** Salary Structure M3/A



At Servus Credit Union, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting people before profits, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: our members, our employees, and our communities. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, we want to meet you.



 Join Servus and discover a better way to work.



Reporting to the Agriculture and Agribusiness Vice President, the RVP, Agriculture Banking is the internal expert for all things agribusiness at Servus Credit Union, contributing to the evolution of our strategic plan and market presence. Cultivating a trusted presence in Alberta agriculture, this role ensures the team at Servus is seen as leaders in the industry, supporting traditional and emerging operations and industry practice. Responsible for the execution of the annual business and strategic plans, this role motivates and influences the team to deliver a remarkable member experience, retain and acquire members, and grow our market share while also ensuring operational efficiency and risk management practices are in place.


**What you’ll be doing:**


* Leads the overall performance of the agriculture team, ensuring strong employee experience, member experience, financial results, operational efficiency, and high‑quality sales and service delivery tailored to agricultural members.
* Builds a high‑engagement, high‑performance culture grounded in trust, accountability, innovation, and continuous development to support a specialized agriculture team.
* Collaborates with organizational leaders to develop and execute agriculture‑focused business plans, targets, and budgets that drive revenue growth, profitability, and market share.
* Develops and executes market strategies specific to the agriculture sector to grow wallet share, strengthen member advocacy, and support retention, acquisition, and long‑term financial outcomes.
* Ensures strong team capability through goal setting, coaching, performance management, onboarding, upskilling, and career development, with emphasis on deep agricultural expertise.
* Maintains a strong presence in the agriculture market, leading business development efforts, engaging key centers of influence, and representing the credit union as an industry expert within the agricultural community.


**What you bring:**


* 10 years’ experience in Agriculture Banking.
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in a leadership role.
* Proven ability to lead a high\-performing team.
* Completed a relevant diploma, degree, or designation program with specialization in agriculture and/or finance, accounting, or law.
* Personal experience in agriculture/farming or ranching is an asset.
* An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be considered.

  


**What happens next?**



We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.



At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!


**Employment Eligibility for external candidates:** The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.



\#indh
title: Regional Vice President - Agriculture

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** **\-** **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**


**Posting closes:** Upon selection of successful candidate.


**Employment Status:** Part\-time, temporary, 20 hours per week.


**For Internal Use Only:** U1/B



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



We are hiring for a temporary, part\-time **Member Experience Advisor** at our **Whitecourt Branch!**



The Member Experience Advisor role acts as the first line of support as members work towards their financial goals. This role is responsible for providing exceptional member service by completing transactional banking services that are right for every member, providing solutions to financial needs or referring members to an appropriate specialist, and contributing to the branch portfolio, and overall growth objectives.


**What You'll be Doing:**


* Provides exceptional member service that builds trust through responsive service and support to deliver what is right for every member, while balancing the interests of the credit union.
* Processes a variety of cash and non\-cash member service transactions including deposits, withdrawals, payments, account updates, balances, money orders, credit card advances, calculations of foreign and domestic exchanges, cheque cashing, electronic funds transfers, and account closures.
* Pursues and generates sales referrals by proactively promoting Servus products and services to members and potential members by analyzing their needs; clearly explains potential solutions and the benefits to the member; records all referrals and forwards to the appropriate internal personnel.
* Builds trust with members, resolves routine problems with member accounts and refers complex questions to the appropriate internal personnel.
* Applies policies and procedures in daily activities to meet safety, legal and privacy requirements.
* Accountable for area security and internal security audits.
* Educates and demonstrates to members how to use other service delivery channels such as digital and self\-serve with the goal of making it easy.
* Provides support to other branch team members such as making outgoing calls to members, composing routine member correspondence and reports, completing compliance and/or audit activities, completing end\-to\-end processes related to ATM and night deposits, reconciling branch reports (dependent on branch location), etc.
* Assists with opening/closing duties such as balancing of branch daily transmittals, reconciling ATM and night deposit contents, and provides support in administering branch cash services with the associated risk management and control policies.
* Acts as joint custodian on specified combinations; rents, controls, and provides access to safety deposit boxes; maintains related records.
* Maintains up\-to\-date knowledge of all credit union products and services in order to foster business development through service excellence and product knowledge.
* Promotes and participates in branch campaigns and initiatives.


**What you Bring:**


* 1\-year experience in a customer service or administration role.
* Sales experience an asset.
* Grade 12 diploma or equivalent.
* An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be considered.
* Good computer skills; able to pick up new and existing programs related to the job quickly.
* Good communication skills; both written and verbal.
* Ability to problem solve, organize and multi\-task.
* Good customer service orientation.
* Attention to detail.
* Aptitude for numbers, with fast and accurate data entry skills.
* Good financial literacy.
* Good investigative skills for uncovering member needs.


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to* *apply!*


***Employment Eligibility:*** *The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.*


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**


*We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and* *only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.*

title: Member Experience Advisor - Whitecourt

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**



We are hiring for a **Financial Advisor/ Senior Financial Advisor** in our **McKenzie Towne Branch.**


**Posting Closes:** Open Until Filled



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.

**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



Reporting to the Branch Manager, your primary objective is to bring our noble purpose to life by developing long term relationships with members, building trust, and delivering customized financial solutions that shape their financial fitness.


**What you’ll be doing:**

* Identifying opportunities to match members with the right products and solutions that help shape their financial fitness
* Meeting and exceeding sales targets and referral goals
* Participating and assisting in business development plans through corporate/branch marketing campaigns
* Demonstrating excellent communication skills and engaging members in conversations to determine their immediate needs
* Developing ongoing knowledge of our current investment/retail banking services and products (e.g., mutual funds, underwriting, credits, loans, investment needs, etc.)
* Promoting referrals to our Wealth Management, Business Banking teams, and our 3rd party providers
* Building a comprehensive knowledge of the local market, competitive offers, and economic trends
* Adhering to all audits, policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements to mitigate risks of fraud or loss
* Providing outstanding member experience by adhering to Servus' best practices
* Contributing to Servus' unparalleled culture of teamwork, positivity, and collaboration
* Maintaining Servus' positive image in the community


**What you bring:**



To qualify, you will need **at least 2 years of retail banking or related financial industry experience, preferably in sales or customer service and a high school diploma.**

Although not required, the following education/certificates are valuable assets:


* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)
* Investment Funds in Canada Course \& License (IFIC)

* Financial Planning I (FP1\)


Most importantly, we're looking for candidates whose personal values align with our cooperative values. These values are evident in everything we do everyday. At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!

Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to* *apply!*

title: Member Experience Advisor - Grade Cache (Temporary)

description:
**Join Servus Credit Union** \- **Canada’s Largest Credit Union!**


***Posting Closes: January 19, 2026***



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



We are looking for a full\-time **Universal Financial Associate** in our **Fort McMurray branches.**


**Your home branch will be Fort McMurray Timberlea branch and you will be required to travel to the following locations as needed: Fort McMurray\- Downtown, Athabasca, Lac La Biche, Plamondon**


* **Due to the nature of this role, interested candidates must hold a valid driver's license and own a reliable vehicle.**



Reporting to the Branch Manager, our Universal Financial Associate plays an integral role in the branch by supporting our members with all their banking needs. As a Universal Financial Associate, you'll prepare documents for member meetings, provide regular proactive contact and follow\-up with members, handle discussions with walk\-in members, and a variety of administrative and branch support activities. You'll also help the branch and our members by processing daily banking transactions and recommending products and services to ensure our members feel good about their money.


**What you’ll be doing:**

* Proactively gather and document all pertinent information required for the Financial Advisor to have a robust conversation.
* Reviewing personal accounts for completeness, accuracy, and ensure they are fully compliant. Look for recommendations to shape the members financial fitness.
* Opening and reviewing new accounts, following up with members as per member service guidelines.
* Preparing and entering loan application information.
* Supporting branch activities to grow new memberships and strengthen our financial relationship with existing members.
* Clearly and skillfully differentiate between credit union and competitor products and services. Present advice and solutions that will serve to improve the member's financial situation
* With accuracy, processing member transactions such as deposits, withdrawals, loan and utility payments, money orders, credit card advances, calculation of foreign and domestic exchange \& cheque cashing


**What you bring:**


* At least **1 year of retail banking or sales experience in addition to your high school diploma.**

Although not required, the following education/certificates are valuable assets:


* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)
* IFIC certification


**Why Servus?**


Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential
* Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!*


***Employment Eligibility:*** *The selected candidate(s) must successfully pass a criminal background check, reference check and credit check to qualify for hire by Servus Credit Union.*


**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**



We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


***Posting Closes: December 14, 2025***

title: Universal Financial Associate - Fort McMurray

description:
Join Servus Credit Union \- Canada’s Largest Credit Union!



We are hiring for a full\-time **Senior** **Financial Advisor** at our **Entwistle Branch!**


**Employment Status:** Permanent, full\-time (37\.5 hours per week within hours of operation)


**Posting closes:** Open until filled.



At **Servus Credit Union**, we do things differently—because we’re a credit union, not a bank. And that difference matters.



We believe in putting **people before profits**, which is why our members are also our owners. Every dollar we earn is reinvested into the things that matter most: **our members, our employees, and our communities**. Whether it’s through profit sharing, competitive rates, or local initiatives that make a real impact, we’re here to help Albertans feel good about their money.



We’re looking for passionate, values\-driven people to join our team. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are aligned with our values and are eager to contribute in meaningful ways. If you're excited to grow your career with a team that’s innovative, hardworking, collaborative and deeply rooted in community, **we want to meet you**.



**Join Servus and discover a better way to work.**



Reporting to the Assistant Branch Manager, your primary objective is to develop long term relationships with members, building trust, and delivering customized financial solutions that help them feel good about their money.


**What you'll be doing:**


* Identifying opportunities to match members with the right products and solutions that help shape their financial fitness
* Meeting and exceeding sales targets and referral goals
* Participating and assisting in business development plans through corporate/branch marketing campaigns
* Demonstrating excellent communication skills and engaging members in conversations to determine their immediate needs
* Developing ongoing knowledge of our current investment/retail banking services and products (e.g., mutual funds, underwriting, credits, loans, investment needs, etc.)
* Promoting referrals to our Wealth Management, Business Banking teams, and our 3rd party providers
* Building a comprehensive knowledge of the local market, competitive offers, and economic trends
* Adhering to all audits, policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements to mitigate risks of fraud or loss
* Providing outstanding member experience by adhering to Servus' best practices
* Contributing to Servus' unparalleled culture of teamwork, positivity, and collaboration
* Maintaining Servus' positive image in the community


**What you bring:**



To qualify, you will need **at least 5 years of retail banking or related financial industry experience, preferably in sales or customer service and a high school diploma and the following:**


* Post\-secondary education in Finance (or related studies)
* Investment Funds in Canada Course \& License (IFIC)
* Personal Financial Service Advice (PFSA)
* Financial Planning I (FP1\)


Most importantly, we're looking for candidates whose personal values align with our cooperative values. These values are evident in everything we do everyday. We're not afraid to be different from our competitors and in fact we embrace these differences. We celebrate our credit union culture and history, and we pride ourselves on our strong commitment to our member\-owners and to the communities we serve.


**Why Servus?**


Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. In addition to standard benefits like health and wellness, vacation and retirement savings programs, we also provide other important benefits such as:


* Competitive compensation including performance\-based incentive pay and profit share
* Training \& Development Opportunities
* Career Advancement Potential
* Flexible work options
* Meaningful work towards individual and corporate goals
* Opportunities to get involved and give back through an employee volunteer program


At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the financial services we provide…with a few additional perks!


**What happens next?**

We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.


*At Servus Credit Union, we believe in being purposefully cooperative and working together to create a culture of Belonging for everyone. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where everyone is valued, respected, and supported. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, and accommodations are available during every stage of the hiring process upon request. Your skills, passion and curiosity may find they belong at Servus, so even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply!*

**Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.**


*We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and* *only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.*
